pr_title: Add redis sentinel configuration for importer

timeline.message:
add redis sentinel configuration for importer

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>

timeline.bodyText: I think we can probably hardcode this in the application.yaml to avoid having to populate the env variable.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,10 @@ importer:
             password: mirror_node_pass
             username: mirror_node
   enabled: true
+  redis:
+    sentinel:
+      enabled: true
+      masterSet: mirror

replies.bodyText: unfortunately setting alone masterSet causes issue since spring expects sentinel nodes to be set if masterSet is set.
replies.author: xin-hedera

replies.bodyText: True, looks like if any property is set it assumes sentinel. There's no enabled flag or check if nodes empty.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: I think we should default this to true so we don't have to turn it on in parent.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -84,6 +84,11 @@ readinessProbe:
   initialDelaySeconds: 60
   timeoutSeconds: 2
 
+redis:
+  sentinel:
+    enabled: false

timeline.bodyText: I think it's safe to always set this variable, so can move sentinel enable check to be just around the sentinel variables. I believe it will construct the URI to sentinel only if the sentinel variables are populated.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -35,8 +35,17 @@ spec:
               value: "true"
             - name: SPRING_CONFIG_ADDITIONAL_LOCATION
               value: "file:/usr/etc/hedera-mirror-importer/"
+            {{- if not .Values.redis.sentinel.enabled }}

timeline.message:
address review feedback

Signed-off-by: Xin Li <xin.li@swirlds.com>
